args: North Grastaea\nThe Military Nation of Svenitla\nDueli Mountains
This blizzard grows increasingly violent.\nHow much further to our destination?
Should be just after this ridge, but let's\nget the lead out. If this storm gets any\nworse, we'll be trapped in a whiteout.
You won't make it out of here if you\ndawdle, so pick up the pace.
Tch. Where does a former imperial general\nget off telling us what to do?
He's been put in charge of this mission,\nso I suggest you stow the griping.
A few days earlier\nSouth Grastaea\nChanzelia Royal Palace
While Satan was attacking Grams,\nthe demon Jaldabaoth took the chance\nto invade the nation of Svenitla.
King Galkin thought his army stood\nlittle chance against the demon, so he\nabandoned his post and went into hiding.
He abandoned his people to save himself?\nBah. What a pathetic excuse for a regent.
Galkin's grandnephew, Prince Litvinov\ntook up command of the army and faced\ndown the demon himself.
With the aid of the Halidom, they managed\nto dispel the demon, and Prince Litvinov\nsoon seized the reins of power.
I am surprised Galkin did not try to slink\nback to the throne once the dust settled.
Prince Litvinov made certain\nthat would not happen.
He had suffered under his granduncle's\ntyrannical rule, and had secretly been\nscheming revolution for some time.
As we speak, Litvinov is attempting to end\nall the wars Svenitla has started in the\nsurrounding countries.
The skirmishes have been endless,\nso all sides are quite eager to complete\na cease-fire agreement.
I think {player_name} will have\nan easier time of it in the north\nshould that come to pass.
However, it is unlikely Galkin will sit back\nand permit his power to be usurped so.

You always were the clever one, Valyx.
As a matter of fact, Galkin has already
contacted criminal organizations and is
gathering weapons and men as we speak.

Should that bloodthirsty cur regain power,
he will no doubt begin waging wars
again—wars that serve the interest of
himself and the privileged classes alone.
With the threat of the Progenitor looming,\nwe cannot afford such infighting amongst\nour possible allies.

Yet if Svenitla is dragged into a series
of battles against Galkin's mercenaries,
it will quickly become a problem of
equal standing.
Indeed it will. Thankfully, your darling\nsister has a plan...

Galkin will not expect Alberia to enter this
fray, which is why I am leading a secret
force in hopes of resolving the situation
quickly and quietly.

And while I appreciate you guiding us,
I am surprised that you are allowing
foreign soldiers to operate in your lands
with such impunity.

Prince Litvinov is similar to his late father
in his flexible thinking. This is why he
summoned me back even after I
abandoned my homeland.

More importantly, that mountain hut is
our destination. Our informant will provide
us with further information and hopefully
a bowl of warm soup.
One bowl of soup for the freezing man.\nIt's hot, so let me...blow on it.

That, er, will not be necessary, Malora.
I must admit, when I heard Chelle had
secured us a skilled spy, I never expected
it might be you.
I am merely delighted to be together\nwith you again, my dear general.
Spare the flattery and tempt me with\nyour information instead.
Tch! You're still such a stick in the mud.\nBut if you insist...

Galkin's mercenaries are using the coal
mine ahead of us as a base. Also, they're
armed with magical weapons purchased
on the black market.
Tell us more of this mine.
It's quite difficult to navigate, but I\nmanaged to procure a sketch of the\nlayout.
It IS, isn't it? Oh, and in other news,\nthose goons have been scaring nearby\nvillages into supplying them with food.

Hearing that, I posed as a villager in order
to get nice and cozy with the soldiers—
and my, but they had EVER so much they
wanted to tell me.
The fact they would reveal their secrets\nso easily says much about the manner\nof enemy we face.
Well then, Malora? How do they procure\nthis food of theirs?
They have the villagers load up a cart\nand then haul it off—and the next pickup\nis scheduled for three days from now.
We can't attack them head-on with a unit\nof this size or we'll be slaughtered.
Instead, we'll hide in the cart and\ninfiltrate their base.
Once inside, we'll suppress them as\nquickly as we can and end this before\nit can start. Understood?
I'm surprised a big, strong warrior like\nyou would rely on the element of surprise.

A skilled warrior fights with mind as well
as blade. I have been entrusted with
these soldiers' lives, and will not lose
a single one if I can help it.
With the storm died down, I was\nthinking to take in the fresh air.
Look, I know this is a weird time to ask,\nbut what was this Valyx guy doing in\nAlberia in the first place?
I know he's the prince's brother and all,\nbut he was a general for the Empire\nbefore, right?
I heard he was brought in to help\nstrengthen their defenses, but who\nknows if that's true or not?

They've got a new emperor over there
who ain't so heavy-handed on the foreign-
affairs front. Maybe he just came crying
'cause they don't need soldiers anymore?
Well, either way, I don't much care for\nsome former imperial general lording it\nover us like he owns the place.
I thought I told you to stow the griping.

I know, I know. But the imperial army
burned my hometown to the ground.
Don't you guys have your own reasons
to hate them?

I hate them for destroying my home
just as you do. But Valyx wasn't directly
responsible, and on top of that, the Empire
isn't what it once was.

I feel conflicted when I remember the
children who died at their hands, and
yet it would be wrong to cling to such
hatred forever.
And even though they tried to execute me,\nI'm willing to let bygones be. If you don't\nlet go of the past, it will destroy you.
Stepped out to allow your underlings to air\ntheir grievances, eh? Quite considerate of\nyou to let 'em say their piece.
It is understandable that they'd feel that\nway. As their leader, it is my job to give\nthem the opportunity to vent their bile.

I hear your companions were slain by the
imperial army as well. As their former
general, I offer my apologies. You may
take your anger out on me if you wish it.
I took plenty of imperial lives myself,\nso let's just call it even.
But I still have questions about you.

It should have been obvious that your
homeland had been corrupted, so why
did you remain after Alberia became
the Dyrenell Empire?

When war breaks out, civilians are roped
into it whether they wish to be or not.
I could not risk the people of my land
suffering because I abandoned it.
But once New Alberia emerged, you could\nhave allied with them and taken out the\nemperor that way, no?

It was my duty to look after my soldiers
and countrymen. Had I abandoned them,
I would be no different than the former
king of your own land.
So it was ultimately always about\nprotecting your own countrymen, then?\nHmm. That makes sense.
But your words will likely ring hollow to\nthose who lost all to the imperial army,\nno matter if they see the logic in it or not.
I care not if they understand my choices.\nAll that matters is our working together\nto fulfill a mutual goal.
I think everyone involved in this particular\nmission will likely accept that line of\nreasoning, but are YOU okay with it?
Eavesdropping, is it? I cannot claim\nto approve of such behavior.
I AM a spy, darling. Also, rule number one\nfor getting the man you want is to gather\nevery bit of information you can on him.

Remember when we last saw each other?
I said I could have you within my grasp no
matter how brusque you are—which is
precisely why I decided to look into you.
Including everything you did as a\ngeneral of the imperial army.
You weren't JUST trying to protect the\nempire—you wanted to protect everyone\nwho lived in South Grastaea.
If you feel too awkward to admit it,\nI can tell them for you and spare you\nfrom their harsh words and thoughts.
...My actions do not change the suffering\nthey endured at the hands of the imperials.
Any excuses would merely add fuel to the\nfire, so I would ask you keep whatever\ninformation you sussed out to yourself.
Ever the people person, aren't you?\nOh, but this can't be good for you...
I know you care about the people\nmore than anyone...
